intro: Streblosa palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan streblus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. It is typically found in lowland forests and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
